tips.text: Create an emergency kit with essential supplies such as water, food, medications, and important documents.
Prepare your home by securing loose items, moving valuables to higher ground, and turning off utilities.
Develop a family emergency plan with evacuation routes and meeting points.
Stay informed about the flood situation through local authorities and weather alerts.
Avoid walking or driving through floodwaters, as they can be deeper or faster-moving than they appear.
If instructed to evacuate, leave immediately and follow evacuation routes to higher ground.
Wait for authorities to declare it safe before returning home or entering flood-affected areas.
Avoid contact with floodwaters, as they may be contaminated with sewage or hazardous chemicals.
Document damage to your property and belongings for insurance claims.
